name: Petra
info: This ancient city, also known as the Rose City, is carved into rock and was once a thriving trading center. It's a UNESCO World Heritage site and one of Jordan's most popular tourist destinations.

name: Jerash
info: This well-preserved Roman city is located north of Amman and is one of the largest and most impressive Roman ruins in the world.

name: Wadi Rum
info: This desert landscape is known for its towering red sandstone cliffs and vast expanses of sand dunes. It's a great place to go on a jeep tour or hike.

name: Dead Sea
info: This saltwater lake is the lowest point on Earth and is known for its healing properties. Visitors can float in the buoyant water and slather themselves in mineral-rich mud.

name: Amman
info: Jordan's capital city is a vibrant and bustling metropolis with a rich history. Highlights include the Roman Theatre, the Citadel, and the Jordan Museum.

name: Aqaba
info: This Red Sea port city is a popular destination for diving and snorkeling, with clear waters and a rich variety of marine life.
